Date Published: August 24, 2020   |   Author: Sophie Su   |   Length: 359 Words

COVID-19 Innovation Internship

Life during the pandemic has been hard for the most, millions of people experienced job loss followed by food insecurity. The goal of this internship is to motivate us young adult to act on however we can to help our community. For many of us whose internships are canceled in the COVID summer, CommuniAmerica offered the opportunity for us to gain real-world experience with its innovation internship. A total of 357 interns were hired divided into 43 highly diverse teams with mixed gender, race, and culture with different experiences and skill sets. We are to research and identify pandemic-related marketing issues around our community, uncover innovative solutions addressing these specific problems to make a societal impact.



During the six-week program, we leverage our skills through zoom meetings, text messages, and customer relationship management system in reviewing CommunityAmerica products and services, offering ideas on how market could be improved for young consumers. We work with entrepreneurs around the community to learn their concerns, many of which are earning no income during the crisis. We brainstorm ideas on what we could do and take into action, some creations by our intern group were mental health applicationto support COVID-19 isolation, or video recording application for long distance communication.


Our team specifically, aims at those who does not have the access to help. In fact, there is a great number of food, housing, and billing assistance available around our community, but many of us simply donâ€™t know about it. Our creation was a COVID-19 community resource website that gathers and post available assistances around our community for those who needs to reach out. This was a great internship that translate our student vision into profound actions, yet the opportunity to lead positive changes in the community around us. Personally, I gained insight into diving into problems with the team member and work to pivot our plan and solution. Our site was made possible only because we had the diverse skillset from everyone, some of those who knows the community well, engineers sector responsible for building the site, and research sector responding to requests!
